With full Armor Penetration, Spy deals 937.5 damage to a giant with one backstab. With max Attack Speed, he can backstab three times before the giant turns around, allowing him to deal 2812.5 damage to a giant (unless it's a Giant Medic, which never turns around to backstabs, allowing Spy to 0-death it.) Once the giant turns around, spy just needs to duck for cover, surf the damage or pop the dead ringer and redisguise, wait for the giant to focus on something else, and repeat. Spy can kill every regular giant in the game with only two backstab chains, and Giant Medics with only one 5 backstab chain. Spy is so much stronger than people give him credit for lmao

WRITING.TITLE: What is your preferred Soldier banner?
WRITING.TEXT: [View Poll](https://www.reddit.com/poll/ib6jse)

People have played MvM so much that they're sick of anything wrong their teammates do. It sounds like you were kicked for being an "Idle Med," a term for Medics who prioritize support over constant kritz (i.e. buys Healing Mastery and Overheal Expert instead of Canteen Specialist and Uber Duration). Non-Idle Med is the most viable way to play Medic since it compensates for his worst weakness in MvM; lack of damage. However, I don't expect beginner Medics like you to be able to play at this level yet, and the kick was completely unjustified. Try not to let these toxic players get to you and I encourage you to keep playing and get better. MvM is a really fun gamemode and it'd be a huge shame if a couple of dumb people turned you off the whole mode.

WRITING.TITLE: Bearded Expense's entire inventory was stolen.
WRITING.TEXT: He lost everything of value from TF2, including all his Heavy items like the Unusual Hound Dogs. He had Two Factor Authentication and had not clicked any fishy links. The only possibility he can think of as to how this happened is via Marketplace.tf and selling keys there. You can find more details in Big Joey's recent stream, where he finds out himself. Change your passwords and write down your Steam recovery code somewhere and stay safe.

According to his former friends, most notably Sentro, he doesn't seem like the most pleasant person to be around off-camera. (Screenshots from Bearded's server) [https://imgur.com/a/LFnsISJ](https://imgur.com/a/LFnsISJ) His content's decent but I have no respect for the guy.
[https://www.twitch.tv/videos/730454232](https://www.twitch.tv/videos/730454232)
57:26 is his initial reaction. Bearded talks about it for the rest of his time in the stream.
If I were that heavy I'd be so pissed lol

Med and Spy move at 107% average speed (Slightly faster than Pyro, Sniper and Engineer at 100%, but slower than Scout at 133%) So yeah, you don't lose any speed. Med's a pretty damn good disguise but I prefer Pyro and Sniper since they're more common in pubs.

If you upgrade it; Damage Scout has solid dps, but in early waves where you only have enough for mobility upgrades, you're better off with the Scattergun or the Soda Popper. In late waves though, yeah I agree, Shortstop is pretty damn good.

Thanks for the feedback, whenever I play scout I pretty much always use Stock/Popper, Milk and FoW, so my experience with most of the other unlocks is limited. You gave me a lot of insight and stuff I never thought about, maybe next time I hop in MvM I'll give the Cane or Sandman a try. I hope to see you tomorrow for the Soldier list!

Giants aren't knocked back by the Force A Nature, it justs forces them to hop in place like pre-JI airblast. Also the Shortstop's shove is just as good (bad) at pitting bots, and at least the Shortstop doesn't make your teammates that need to aim want to strangle you.

WRITING.TITLE: The MvM Weapon Tier Lists; Day #2: The Ballistic One Man Army American

WRITING.TEXT: So, there's two ways to play each class in MvM, passive and aggressive, with aggressive playstyles being harder but much stronger. Passive playstyles are types that beginners fall into, and they more or less mean just fulfilling whatever your class can do without expanding past it. For example, a Scout who upgrades resistances instead of his primary can be considered passive, since he is only focusing on money instead of helping with damage. Aggressive playstyles is when you push your class' abilities to the extreme and make riskier but more rewarding upgrade choices. A Medic who upgrades Canteen Specialist, Uber Duration and Ubersaw swing speed has his Kritz charge up much, MUCH more often than a passive Medic. The Buff Banner is a passive banner. It only serves to help your team with a fairly small damage boost and isn't strong against tanks without another player helping (The time it takes to blow the banner offsets the potential increase in damage by yourself.) The Conch is a different story; it drastically increases Soldier's survivability by allowing his high damage to come back as health, and the speed boost allows him to dodge bot attacks much better. The longer you're alive, the more damage you will do. It also offsets the immediate need for resistances, allowing you to allocate more money into your primary.

It's ok, I got 3.6k and am still learning about dumb stuff I should've already known about (Heavy can bhop with stock?! being the most recent one for me.) The main point of the tier list series is for me to make sure I got my MvM priorities straight, and I plan to do something similar later down the line for upgrades.
It's tight and hard to get used to but it's possible. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EdnxetMN\_xU](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EdnxetMN_xU)
So just don't use the charge shot.
I mean, it's not hard to outdamage a passive scout. Hopefully that was a fun mission though

Burn damage is negligible in MvM, 8 dps isn't a lot in a gamemode where no bot is less than 110 hp (which is why Pyro's afterburn upgrades are so bad.) You can do a lot more damage with the Mangler just shooting your entire clip.

WRITING.TITLE: The MvM Weapon Tier Lists; Day #3: The Tank Eating Glass Cannon

WRITING.TEXT: The Dragon's Fury sacrifices crowd control and tank damage for giant damage, and at that point you should just play Heavy. Also, the Backburner is superior in damage to giants thanks to the guaranteed crits from behind, so nothing about the Fury is particularly useful.

The knockback the Scorch Shot deals makes it harder for your team to shoot the giant, making it take longer to actually destroy it rather than just burning it with your primary. Your Sniper is going to strangle you if you do this.
welp never playing steel again

That's true, but that means your team let a bomb reach the hatch. In a situation where you're team is doing well, airblast isn't worth more than reflecting projectiles. Also, having airblast means you're not using the Phlog, which means your Tank damage will be subpar. So by default airblast is gimped on Tank waves.

Then just don't taunt? Phlog has decently high dps without the crits and Super Scouts don't have a lot of health. Also, there are certain spots on every MvM map you can just bodyblock the Scouts with your taunt and give your team more time to shoot them. Here's a sentry on a bodyblock spot in Rottenburg: [https://imgur.com/a/kbkKel7](https://imgur.com/a/kbkKel7)

WRITING.TITLE: The MvM Weapon Tier Lists; Day #4: The Gaelic Burst Destructor

WRITING.TEXT: Knockback, makes bots harder to kill for your teammates because the cannonballs knock them all over the place. Using it just makes waves unnecessarily longer because no one can follow up on your dumb 50 damage cause the 12 scouts are now 8 feet away from each other.

I see the shields as strictly better options than the Jumper for Pipe Demo since they have free resistance and the charge gives you mobility instantly. Also Sticky Launchers do the same thing while also being able to be used for damage when needed. You do make a good point about the GL and IB though, I always forget the Bomber has smaller explosion radius.
Glad you're having fun in boot camp, but the other three launchers easily do more damage and ravage the clusters of giants and tanks harder in 666.

"If you time your shots correctly," You're already wasting time trying to have your cannonball detonate at the right time that could've been used just holding down M1. "the loose cannon can always do more dmg than the other launchers," Loose Cannon can't be fired nearly as fast as the other three launchers, which gimps it's overall dps. Also you can't double donk Tanks. "and do some knock back" Knockback in MvM is bad in almost all scenarios. See my reply to u/SmileInteractive.
Yes. Make sure to upgrade jump height and health regen first, and get some ammo canteens.

WRITING.TITLE: The MvM Weapon Tier Lists; Day #5: The Fat n' Meaty Chunk of Beef

WRITING.TEXT: Scottish Resistance is always better than any Launcher with low money, i.e. early waves. A weapon that can be used effective the entire mission is always going to be better than one that forces you to wait until later waves to get better.

That's true but that's a very specific situation that's not going to come up often on lots of missions. The Loose Cannon is only useful if two giants spawn but are about to drop into the map desynced; not very common outside Empire wave 6.
You could've done that with a normal Sticky Launcher and had a backup damage option when you A. run out of pipes or B. are preparing for bots to drop into the map.

The 20% damage bonus is very nice since the minigun doesn't get damage upgrades, but the rev time and movement speed penalties means: \- You are not going to kill anything that get past you \- It's harder to switch positions \- You're eating every attack those bots are going to throw at you \- Approaching giants to abuse damage ramp-up is much slower Brass Beast isn't bad, but the other miniguns don't have these problems.

"medium range" "Works well especially early on when you would get deleted by heavies" What are you talking about? Heavies don't suddenly not deal damage outside of close range. Also the range increase on the Fury is so small it's not even notable in a PvE gamemode.

Super Scouts are the only bots you ever have to worry about slowing down, and every MvM map has plenty of spots Heavy can just stand and bodyblock them. You're better off with any other minigun that can deal more damage, thus killing the Scouts faster.

It doesn't heal teammates as much as the Sandvich and it doesn't provide extra max health. The faster recharge is useless in a mode where you should be shooting your primary all the time. Easily the worst weapon for Heavy in MvM.
If your Engineer properly maintains his dispenser, you shouldn't ever need to use anything else but your minigun.

WRITING.TITLE: The MvM Weapon Tier Lists; Day #6: The Helpful Construction Man

WRITING.TEXT: This tier list is for MvM. The Eureka Effect definitely has uses in casual but it's a direct downgrade against bots.

In MvM, the two upsides of the Eureka Effect are useless. Buildings you place in setup time are already put up to Level 3, and Teleporters should not be in a position to get destroyed by bots. Therefore the Teleporter upgrade discount is worthless. You can buy Teleport to Spawn Canteens if you desperately need to warp back to spawn midwave for a puny 10 credits. You buy a 2way Teleporter to get back to spawn quickly. Hell, you could even just killbind and buyback. There are more ways to get back to spawn fast without using the Eureka Effect. The wrench just ends up being slower at constructing buildings and getting less metal from your Dispenser. Just use stock.

A Wrangled Sentry deals more damage than a fully upgraded Pistol. Fully Upgraded Pistol: 168 dps Damage added by Wrangling a Level 3 Sentry: 431 - 230 = 201 dps If you want to use a weapon to help your sentry with damage, use the Widowmaker (286 dps) Source for damage numbers: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1xvjPQtSAd9rTK6VGueQS9XWVpLEiaQh02zmA2JpltWg/edit#gid=0](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1xvjPQtSAd9rTK6VGueQS9XWVpLEiaQh02zmA2JpltWg/edit#gid=0)

Bleed damage is negligible in MvM, 8 dps is not a lot in a mode where the weakest bots have 110 health. You should not be attacking bots with your melee weapon as a low health class with upgrade priorities away from resistances. If you're having trouble with spies, equip a shotgun like the Widowmaker or the Frontier Justice. Spy bots are not intelligent and give you more than enough time for you to react and kill them when they decloak and approach. Basic awareness is all you need. All the Hospitality is after that is an extra vulnerability to Flamethrowers and Flares, a direct downgrade. Just use stock.
This list is for MvM.

WRITING.TITLE: The MvM Weapon Tier Lists; Day #7: The Licenseless Medical Operative

WRITING.TEXT: Can we get an F for all the poor pub Heavies that get Bazooked on every day
Yes, plus stock and the Overdose have it too.

You're right that the QF can heal and revive really good, however, the QF doesn't have "infinite shields," it has faster shield build rate. If your team really badly needs your shield to be up as much as possible, you could just invest some money into Healing Mastery and still be able to kritz/instant revive. All the QF can do is be slightly better for a passive Medic who only heals and revives, which is a waste of a slot on competent teams. Also, sure, most Kritz Medics don't do jack, but that doesn't mean the Kritz itself is bad or should be placed lower than the top. It's able to be pushed into making Medic an actually worthy pick by multiplying his team's damage output consistently.

Yeah this is a clear testament to how little I play Med I guess. This is the first time I've ever been shown something even close to this. Can't find a video about it, I haven't seen it in practice and have never had a more experienced player recommend this before, which kinda makes me wonder if it's actually viable at all or it was buried by 2C boys. Thanks for bringing this to my attention, I'll need to try this kind of playstyle out for a while.

WRITING.TITLE: The MvM Weapon Tier Lists; Final Day: The Overhated Giant Slaying Monsieur

WRITING.TEXT: The only real use I've found from Sappers is slowing Super Scouts for your team, but that's pretty niche and it causes them to turn around. I still think that's more of a use than anything his revolvers can do though. Idk, what do you think?

It unbuilds them.

Well said. I've been trying to get better in MvM, playing missions other than 2C, playing on [potato.tf](https://potato.tf) and trying to get advice from their discord. You've been a big help in helping me see what's good and what's not in weapons and even introduced me to Shield Basher Med. Thank you.

There's a MvM specific nerf to the YER that adds a 3 second delay before a backstab gives you a disguise. That's plenty of time for bots to turn around, notice you and attack. And since you can't disguise manually without deleting your entire Dead Ringer charge, it forces you to use one of the worse cloaks so you can recharge from ammo packs. You're better off with any other knife.

In order to be stunned by the Holiday Punch: \- The Heavy needs to have his melee out \- He needs to be in melee range \- He needs to be behind you (Actually behind, not spy 180 degree backstab hitbox behind) \- You need to not be jumping \- You need to not be a disguised spy \- You need to not be already doing another taunt #8203; In order to be stunned by the Sandman: \- Scout needs to have his melee out \- He needs to be able to aim a projectile ... Comparing the two is dumb.

Medics should not be able to defend themselves well. If they could they'd be blatantly overpowered, being able to be a decent dps and also being able to put out tons of support. Being a Medic is sacrificing your own damage in favor of supporting the rest of your team.

There's an option to disable slurs but keep the rest of the naughty words. Why the fuck is that not the default option? I get not wanting to see the pyro main calling every one an n-word but profanity is just a part of the online gaming dialect at this point.

Pumpkin Bombs should be at the bottom. They take too long to use effectively, they spread in a way that makes them impossible to hide, and they're so easy to nullify by just shooting them. Jump and Teleport at least give your class more mobility, Pumpkin Bombs don't have any practical use.
